titleStmt.title: James P. Barbour et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4625

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Washington County Ky
February 15th 1864
His Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Washington County would respectfully petition your excellency to remit the fine ^for $400 -- ^ received against Maudville Elliott, received at the Mar Term of the Washington Circuit Court for failing to attend in discharge of his recognition as a witness for the Commonwealth in the case of the Commonwealth is Matt Isaacs & Siles Bolling charged with felony, as from our knowledge of Mr Elliott we are satisfied that he subjected himself to the forfeiture innocently and for no improper purpose, and from the impression that there could be no treat of the cause, from the fact that Isaacs was known to be absent in the Federal army.

Jas P Barbour Clk of the Washington Circuit Court
C F Bosley Sheriff of W C
John M Smith
S D Hall

John McIntire
J. R Claybrook
John C. Paddack
Richard Jefferson
W. H. Kinberlin
M R Hardin
G G Kendrick

Washington Cir Ct
vs
M. Elliott
Forfeiture $100
18th Feby/ 64

Remit except fees & costs & hand to R J browne (HR)
T E Bramlette
